SEARCH
Package org.codehaus.mojo.keytool.services

Class CertificateManagementService

java.lang.Object
org.codehaus.mojo.keytool.services.CertificateManagementService
@Named @Singleton public class CertificateManagementService extends Object
Service for managing certificates in keystores using Java KeyStore API. Follows Single Responsibility Principle (SOLID-S).
Since:
2.0

  • Method Details

    • importCertificate

      public void importCertificate(File keystoreFile, String keystoreType, char[] keystorePassword, String alias, File certificateFile, boolean skipIfAliasExists, char[] keyPassword) throws KeyStoreException, IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, CertificateException
      Import a certificate into a keystore.

      This method supports two scenarios:

      • Importing a trusted certificate (new alias or replacing a trusted certificate)
      • Importing a certificate reply to replace the certificate chain of an existing key pair
      Parameters:
      keystoreFile - keystore file
      keystoreType - keystore type (e.g., "JKS", "PKCS12")
      keystorePassword - keystore password
      alias - certificate alias
      certificateFile - certificate file to import
      skipIfAliasExists - if true, skip import if alias already exists
      keyPassword - password for the private key (if different from keystore password); may be null
      Throws:
      KeyStoreException - if keystore operation fails
      IOException - if file operations fail
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm is not available
      CertificateException - if certificate is invalid

    • exportCertificate

      public void exportCertificate(File keystoreFile, String keystoreType, char[] keystorePassword, String alias, File outputFile) throws Exception
      Export a certificate from keystore to file.
      Parameters:
      keystoreFile - keystore file
      keystoreType - keystore type
      keystorePassword - keystore password
      alias - certificate alias
      outputFile - output file for certificate
      Throws:
      Exception - if operation fails

    • deleteAlias

      public void deleteAlias(File keystoreFile, String keystoreType, char[] keystorePassword, String alias) throws Exception
      Delete an alias from keystore.
      Parameters:
      keystoreFile - keystore file
      keystoreType - keystore type
      keystorePassword - keystore password
      alias - alias to delete
      Throws:
      Exception - if operation fails
